FuncDef:
The loop-detect packet priority command configures the priority of loop-detect protocol packet.
The undo loop-detect packet priority command restores the priority of loop-detect protocol packet.
By default, the priority of loop-detect protocol packet is 6.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the priority of loop-detect protocol packet.
The value is an integer ranging from 0 to 7.

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
The loop-detect packet priority command can be configured on an interface only after loop detection is enabled globally and the loop-detect enable command is configured on the sub-interface.
